Who: LEGACY, Tuscon, Perceptor, Talon, Straight Shot, Quickstride
Location:=
 Deep Earth caverns not far from the Black Fortress

> "Woahh, a little mor=
e pest control than I bargained for! Legacy, Talon, you two okay?!"

Legacy=
 quickly looked around the battlefield, noting the somewhat
diminished numb=
er of combatants, "I am undamaged." he said in his
typically cold tones as =
he continued to attempt to pick off some of
the enemy.

> Straight Shot too=
, finds herself firing off arrows just to try and slow the insect beings do=
wn, while she desperately tries to help Perceptor.
>
> "Perceptor, I need y=
ou to turn off your audio sensors for a short time. I'm going to attempt a =
sonar blast which I hope will slow things down for us enough to get to Rodi=
mus. That way I know I will not harm you when I do emit this attack. Straig=
ht Shot, when I'm through doing that, tap him on the shoulder to let him kn=
ow it's safe to turn them back on."

As the alien insectoid menace of 5 con=
tinued to advance, the next
round of combat began!

Tuscon gave orders to P=
erceptor to shut down his audio receptors, and
thereby holding his attack.
=

Perceptor, desperately tried to turn off his receptors, and as if like
a s=
witch had been thrown his whole world went dark as his sensors
which in man=
y ways relied on hearing was short down. He could still
smell the attacking=
 creatures approach, but in no way would this sense
of smell allow him to f=
ire under battle conditions.

Seeing that Perceptor had successfully went d=
ark he let loose with his
sonic discharge, sending wave after disruptive wa=
ve into the tunnel!

For a moment the insectoid creatures looked at Tuscon =
as a strange
sort of intelligence flashed through their optics before each =
one, one
by one slumped over, victims of his attack. They all fell into sta=
sis
lock.

However at the same time, due perhaps to the wide area sonic att=
ack,
the walls themselves around the group began to rumble and shake as
bit=
s of stone and debris began to fall from the ceiling.

Although Perceptor c=
ould not see or hear, his vibrational sensors and
his digger's instincts to=
ld him one thing: CAVE IN!!!!!

(OOC: be very cautious about having charact=
ers doing a lot in your
next post(s) as there is not much time! BWHAHAHAhah=
ahah!!)

Preston
